HOME.TITLE: WE ARE GETTING MARRIED!
HOME.DETAILS: And we are thrilled to be able to share this experience with you! If you want to know more about our story, J-Y's lovely proposal in Liverpool and, of course, all the details about our wedding, as well as information for your upcoming trip to Galicia, look no further: it's all here!

OUR-STORY.TITLE: OUR STORY
OUR-STORY.ENCOUNTER: A loooong long time ago -seven years to be precise- Jean-Yves, a smart and responsible aerospace engineering student, decided Glasgow would be the perfect destination for his Erasmus year. A few days after his arrival, he went on a trip to Edinburgh, the Scottish capital. There, among bagpipes, whisky and haggis, there was a group of Spanish ladies. Little did he know that he would end up proposing to one of them seven years later!
OUR-STORY.BEGINNING: María and Jean-Yves (aka Chantal) spent some time together over the following weeks and got to know each other. They started dating after a frightening Halloween soirée and J-Y declared his love under the beautiful Ferris Wheel in Liverpool, during a nice -and cold!- trip to the city of the Beatles.
OUR-STORY.ERASMUS: They had a great Erasmus year together... But, unfortunately, after a few amazing but short months, Jean-Yves had to go back to Toulouse and do his internship, and María had to finish her undergraduate studies in Vigo. It was quite scary at the beginning, but it also meant they both got to travel very often over the following few -not so few!- years.
OUR-STORY.NICE: Jean-Yves soon moved to Nice, and María visited him as often as she could.
OUR-STORY.INTERPRETER: She had decided she wanted to become a conference interpreter. But that meant spending one more year away from J-Y! She moved to Edinburgh to do her master's and, only a few months later, J-Y started working in London.
OUR-STORY.BARNES: When she finished her studies, she finally moved into J-Y's tiny flat in Barnes, west London  ("only" four years after they started dating!).
OUR-STORY.HAPPY: They lived happily ever after, discovering every hidden place in London and travelling together...

PROPOSAL.TITLE: THE PROPOSAL
PROPOSAL.DEPARTURE: After a long busy week at work, Jean-Yves called María on a Friday evening to let her know he was leaving work, as he usually does. Only this time he said: "You need to pack your suitcase. We are leaving in one hour and spending the weekend away."
PROPOSAL.PACKING: María was taken aback. She had no idea what to pack into her suitcase. Summer clothes? Winter clothes? Elegant or casual outfits? She decided to bring a bit of everything. After all, they were only going to be away for a couple of days, as she had an important interpreting job on Monday that she couldn't miss.
PROPOSAL.CARDIFF: J-Y arrived by car an hour and a half later. They were going to Wales! They spent the first evening in Cardiff and then started a roadtrip around the Welsh countryside. The weather was awful but the landscapes were lovely!
PROPOSAL.ROAD-TRIP: On Saturday night they slept in a cosy bed and breakfast in the heart of Snowdonia. The following morning María was so sad that their little weekend break was coming to an end... They still had a day to go though! They visited Snowdonia and Caernarfon and had lunch in Conwy.
PROPOSAL.CONWY: While they were eating lunch, J-Y suggested adding an extra stop to their itinerary before going back to London, as they had plenty of time to spare. He said he was sure María would love that last stop, so she felt a bit intrigued and checked the maps on her phone."Oh my God!", she said, "We are just an hour away from Liverpool! Are we going to Liverpool?"
PROPOSAL.ROAD-TO-LIVERPOOL: And they went to Liverpool indeed. It was one of María's favourite places, as it was the city of the Beatles and she had been there previously, visiting the Cavern and seeing a Paul McCartney concert. It was also a very special place for both of them, as they had been there together at the very beginning of their relationship.
PROPOSAL.LIVERPOOL: They visited Mathew Street, where the John Lennon statue and the Cavern are, and then headed back to Albert Dock, where the car was parked. Jean-Yves suggested a ride on the ferris wheel, to remember their first time in Liverpool. It was very windy, but the wheel was working. Although it all looked like an improvised plan, it turned out J-Y had booked the wheel's luxury cabin, with champagne and chocolates!
PROPOSAL.FERRIS: I think you can guess the end (or should we say the beginning?) of this story. When they were on the ferris wheel, Jean-Yves bent the knee (just like Jon Snow!) and.... spoiler alert: María said YES!!!
PROPOSAL.NIGHT: But that wasn't all: Jean-Yves had more surprises in store for María and the day was not over! He had booked the Paul McCartney suite at the Hard Day's Night Hotel, and a table at the amazing Panoramic 34 restaurant! In the end, María found out she didn't really have an interpreting job the following day... J-Y had thought of every single detail!
PROPOSAL.CONCLUSION: So... this is how this all started! It was a very exciting weekend and we're happy we'll soon have the chance to share one of the most important days of our lives with you all!

CEREMONY.TITLE: CEREMONY
CEREMONY.DETAILS-CEREMONY: The ceremony will take place on
CEREMONY.DETAILS-LOCATION: at San Francisco’s Church in Santiago de Compostela (Galicia, Spain), which is just 150 metres away from the Cathedral.

RECEPTION.TITLE: RECEPTION
RECEPTION.DETAILS: After the religious ceremony, the reception will take place just next door, at the Hotel Monumento

SANTIAGO.TITLE: YOUR TRIP TO SANTIAGO
SANTIAGO.DETAILS: Santiago de Compostela is the capital of the Spanish region of Galicia. It is known as the final stop on the epic Camino de Santiago pilgrimage trail. Its old town is a World Heritage Site, and its arcaded stone streets are impregnated with art, history and legends.
SANTIAGO.VISITS-ONE: You cannot leave Santiago without visiting the Cathedral, which is the reputed burial place of St James the Great, a grand Romanesque structure with later Gothic and Baroque additions, as well as the

GETTING-THERE.TITLE: GETTING THERE
GETTING-THERE.AIRPORT: Santiago de Compostela has an airport with direct flights to and from London (with Ryanair, Easyjet and Vueling), Madrid, Barcelona, Paris (Vueling) and other European destinations.
GETTING-THERE.CORUNA: A Coruña, a city which is only half an hour away from Santiago and that most of you probably know because of its wonderful football team (go Dépor go!), also has an airport with direct flights to and from London (with Vueling).
GETTING-THERE.PORTO: Sometimes flying out to Porto in Northern Portugal can be a good option too. There are many flights to and from London, Paris, Lyon, Toulouse, among other destinations. Then it's possible to travel to Santiago by coach from Porto's airport. The journey takes about three hours.
GETTING-THERE.CAMINO: And of course, for the bravest among you there is one more option: el Camino! But start getting your pilgrim boots ready, as it will take you a few months to reach Santiago and we wouldn't want you to miss such a special occasion! :p

SLEEP.TITLE: WHERE TO SLEEP
SLEEP.DETAILS: There are many different options in terms of accommodation: hotels, Airbnb, hostels, guesthouses... So you shouldn't have any issues finding a place to stay. However, please be aware that Santiago attracts many tourists, especially during the summer, so we highly recommend booking your accommodation as soon as possible!
SLEEP.FRANCISCO: First, you might have noticed our wedding venue is also a
SLEEP.FRANCISCO-DETAILS: It is a beautifully restored old convent and our wedding guests can enjoy a discount if they choose to stay there. Please let us know if you are interested in booking a room there so that we can block it for you. Then you will need to confirm your reservation at least one month in advance,
SLEEP.FRANCISCO-LET-KNOW: letting the hotel know you are coming to our wedding when you confirm the booking.
SLEEP.FRANCISCO-PRICE: The final price with the discount will be €116 per night.
SLEEP.SMALL: However, Santiago is a small town and our wedding will take place in the city centre, so there are many more accommodation options (and most of them more affordable) only a few minutes away from the venue.
SLEEP.SUGGESTION: Here are a few suggestions for travelers with different budgets.

BUDGET.TITLE: IF YOU ARE TRAVELLING ON A BUDGET:
BUDGET.PINARIO: It is just a couple of minutes’ walk from our wedding venue and from the Cathedral. The rooms are quite basic but ensuite, so you will have your own private bathroom, and the location is unbeatable. This place is VERY popular so we recommend booking as soon as possible.
BUDGET.LUCIS: There are many other guest houses and hostels such as

LIKE.TITLE: SOME HOTELS WE LIKE:
LIKE.ALTAMIRA: Functional and contemporary design in the heart of the Old Town. Just a few minutes away from our wedding venue.
LIKE.BIEITO: “Smart” for all the technical gadgets available in the rooms; “literary” for its Galician literature theme. Comfortable rooms in a converted 16th century building. Located in the Old Town.
LIKE.SAN-MIGUEL: Ideal spot for travellers, nestled in the heart of the Old Town.
LIKE.OTHERS: Other options (also located in the Old Town and minutes away from the venue):

EAT.TITLE: WHERE TO EAT
EAT.DESCRIPTION-ONE: around the Cathedral are full of restaurants and bars where you can enjoy delicious Galician tapas such as
EAT.DESCRIPTION-THREE: ... with a glass of Albariño or Ribeiro or a
EAT.DESCRIPTION-FOUR: of Estrella Galicia, our local beer. Here are some recommendations:
EAT.RESTO-ONE: Traditional Galician tapas. Booking in advance is highly recommended.
EAT.NO-TAPAS: And if tapas are not your thing, here are a few restaurants we really like:
EAT.ALTAMIRA: Seasonal Galician dishes with a contemporary twist.

DRINK.TITLE: WHERE TO DRINK
DRINK.DETAILS-ONE: Anywhere. Santiago is full of tiny bars and terraces where you can enjoy some wine or beer. We recommend a wine route (or pub crawl) called “París-Dakar” along two of the
DRINK.DETAILS-TWO: in the Old Town: Rúa do Franco and Rúa da Raíña. It has nothing to do with cars or raids though! There are two bars in Santiago called the París and the Dakar. You must begin your route at the París and drink a glass of wine in each of the bars on that street until you reach the last one, the Dakar. In most places you can sip wine from Galician old-fashioned bowls called
DRINK.DETAILS-THREE: , as you can see on the picture:
DRINK.RECOMMENDED: If you are looking for a nice bar, we recommend:

COSTA.TITLE: A COSTA DA MORTE
COSTA.INTRO: And if you decide to stay in Galicia for a few more days you can visit other Galician cities such as A Coruña, Pontevedra... or head towards the Death Coast!
COSTA.DETAILS: You can visit the Land's End (the Cape Finisterre), the Virxe da Barca Sanctuary in Muxía, enjoy a drink with a view in Lires, walk along Carnota's beach or find the hidden waterfall in Ézaro.
COSTA.CONTACT: Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions, we’ll be happy to help!
COSTA.ENJOY: We really hope you enjoy your trip and we look forward to seeing all of your pictures!

FLIGHT.TITLE: Important update regarding flights and accommodation
FLIGHT.DETAILS-ONE: This is just to let you know that flight and hotel prices for August are increasing, so we strongly recommend that you book your trip as soon as possible! The budget hostel recommended on our site (San Martín Pinario) is no longer available on those dates. Please do not hesitate to
FLIGHT.DETAILS-TWO: if you have any questions regarding accommodation and flights. We’ll be happy to help!
